channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: New integrated development in Yishun with swimming pools, hawker centre to be completed in 2027
item.description:
September 08, 2020 12:20 PM

SINGAPORE - Yishun residents can look forward to a new integrated development at Chong Pang City, which will have swimming pools, a gym and fitness studios, as well as an upgraded hawker centre and community club.

item.title: Injured construction worker rescued from 40m crane by SCDF's elite Dart team
item.description:
September 08, 2020 11:30 AM

SINGAPORE - A man working on a tower crane found himself suspended 40mÂ up and unable to head down to safety, after injuring his leg in mid-air.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Sept 8
item.description:
September 08, 2020 7:45 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Tuesday, Sept 8.

item.title: PCF to help more than 400 staff become class acts
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Principals and other educators of PAP Community Foundation (PCF) Sparkletots centres will be going for more training in curriculum development over the next few years, in PCF's first tie-up with the National Institute of Education (NIE).

item.title: Industry players welcome move to restart Mice sector
Exhibition showcases ST climate change stories
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

An exhibition on climate change and its wide-ranging impact on life in general was launched yesterday by the Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) Foundation.

item.title: Covid-19 safety rules to be implemented as Singapore allows bigger Mice events
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Implementing infection control measures pre-and post-event

item.title: Community care sector gets $5m in donations to aid virus fight
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Those looking after the vulnerable, especially the elderly, received a boost amid the coronavirus pandemic in the form of more than $5 million in donations, including more than $2 million in cash.

item.title: Events firm regained 50% of lost revenue with hybrid model
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

After the coronavirus pandemic hit, about 70 per cent of the contracted projects managed by events company MICE Depot had to be either reworked, delayed or cancelled.

item.title: Law Ministry, Ipos seek public feedback on copyrighted works
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Law (MinLaw) and the Intellectual Property Office of Singapore (Ipos) launched a public consultation yesterday to seek feedback on whether existing exceptions that allow for the digital reproduction of copyrighted works - for purposes such as teaching and fixing key system software - are still relevant.

item.title: Companies continued to hire in Q2 but at slower pace: MOM
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Despite the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on the economy, companies continued to hire during the second quarter, though at a slower pace, a survey by the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) found.

item.title: Man who sexually abused young nephew jailed for 22 years
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

For nearly five years, a boy was sexually abused by his uncle, who started touching the victim inappropriately when he was about five or six years old, and then progressed to more heinous acts.

item.title: Medtech firm hiring staff to grow business in mass testing for virus
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The coronavirus pandemic has hit many sectors hard, but one of the industries that is set to grow instead is medical technology.

item.title: Woman says student tried to grope her on SMU campus
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman who accused a Singapore Management University (SMU) student of molesting her on campus said she had pushed him away and dodged his attempts to kiss her earlier.

item.title: 200 deep tech apprenticeships, full-time positions on offer at fair
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Those keen on being at the bleeding edge of technology and harnessing it to engineer innovations and make scientific discoveries can get ready to dive into the world of deep tech, as a slew of openings and opportunities to learn on the job are coming up at an SGInnovate virtual fair this weekend.

item.title: Flower power at East Coast Park
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Bougainvillea Garden at East Coast Park was awash with colour yesterday as the signature plants blossomed profusely in the recent wet weather.

item.title: Thousands of jobs in Singapore may go in next 6 months, say experts
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Workers have so far been sheltered from the worst economic effects of the pandemic due to substantial government support but there is a limit to what the Government can do, said observers.

item.title: Breach of justice in bankruptcy orders: Apex court
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

In a split decision, the three-judge Court of Appeal in Singapore has ruled that there was a breach of natural justice in the making of bankruptcy-related orders against a businessman and his family by an Indonesian court.

item.title: S'pore to allow bigger Mice events with up to 250 people
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Bigger exhibitions and conferences with up to 250 participants are set to return to Singapore, as the Republic seeks to revive this once-buoyant sector.

item.title: New infections drop to 22 - lowest daily figure since March 16
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 22 new Covid-19 cases was announced by the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday, the lowest daily figure in more than five months since March 16, when there were 17 cases.

item.title: Youth and mentors adapt to stay connected during Covid-19 outbreak
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

As the older child with a brother who is in Primary 2, secondary school student Ayumi Tan does not have an older sibling to guide and advise her.

item.title: AGO highlights lapses by govt agencies
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The Auditor-General's Office (AGO) has flagged weaknesses in IT controls as well as lapses in procurement, contract and operations management in its annual audit report released yesterday.

item.title: 13,000 workers yet to go for routine testing barred from work
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Some 13,000 workers who have yet to undergo rostered routine testing for the coronavirus as at Sunday will be barred from returning to work.

item.title: Guidelines on pricing practices to kick in on Nov 1
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Businesses that engage in misleading advertising practices such as touting prices that omit mandatory fees, for example, have two months to clean up their act.

item.title: Some malls struggling to comply with fire safety rules
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Some shopping malls struggle to comply with fire safety rules even as they abide by Covid-19 safe management measures.

item.title: Consumer protection laws under review to provide more teeth
item.description:
September 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's consumer protection laws may soon have more teeth, with the Government looking into strengthening the enforcement powers of the Competition and Consumer Commission of Singapore (CCCS).
